block.txt: (Section 5.47)

heading.b: Complying development in the following zone—

block.txt: Zone 2 (a) Residential

entry.txt: Development consisting of the erection or carrying out of the following—

headingfloat.b: Single storey single dwelling houses and ground floor single storey additions or alterations to single dwelling houses

block.txt: (excluding areas where the Australian Noise Exposure Forecast (ANEF) exceeds 20)
Maximum height of 5.4m from ground level to the highest point of the roof.
Must be located a minimum of 1.5m off side boundaries.
Must be located a minimum of 4.5m from rear boundaries.
Must be located behind the building line of the property or no further forward than the alignment of any existing building on any adjoining property, whichever is the greater setback.
The maximum amount of cut or fill is restricted to 0.6m and the cut must not extend further than 0.9m beyond the perimeter of the building.
All fill must be retained within the perimeter of the buildings.
For new dwellings, two car parking spaces must be provided behind the building line.
Any car spaces and access provided must comply with the requirements of Australian Standard AS 2890.1—1993, Parking facilities, Part 1: Off-street car parking.
Any driveways provided must be designed to align with footpath crossing levels issued by the Council.
New dwellings must be entitled to at least a 3.5 star rating under the National House Energy Rating Scheme (NatHERS).
Alterations or additions must comply with the energy efficiency standards in the applicable development control plan.
Works are not to include installation of oil or solid fuel heating appliances.
Must comply with Council’s construction standards for buildings located in bushfire prone areas or relevant Council building standards.

Work on that part of residential premises used for the purpose of preparation or storage (or both) of food for sale to the public as part of a home activity use, must comply with the Food Regulation 2001, the Council’s Code for Food Premises and Code for Commercial Home Catering.
Work does not include any commercial mechanical exhaust ventilation system.
Maximum floorspace ratio is 0.4:1.
Minimum landscaped area is 50% of the site area.

headingfloat.b: Subdivision for one or more of the following purposes only:

block.txt: widening of a public road by a public authority, or

adjusting a boundary between allotments, but only if the new lots comply with Chapter 5. The subdivision must not result in an increased number of lots, the re-orientation of the existing allotments or redefinition of the Mean High Water Mark, or
correcting an encroachment on an allotment, but only if the new lots comply with Chapter 5, or

strata subdivision of any building, except dual occupancy housing, approved and constructed after 1 July 1988, subject to the development conforming with all conditions of any applicable development consent, or
consolidation of allotments, if it is development, or
the creation of an allotment for public reserve purposes but only where the residue lot or lots comply with the minimum size standards of Chapter 5.

headingfloat.b: Swimming pools, spas and safety fencing

block.txt: Must be located in the rear or side yard.
Must be located a minimum of 1.0m from side or rear boundaries to the water.
Pools (including in-ground or above-ground) must not exceed 1.0m above ground level with no attached decking within 1.5m of side and rear boundaries (refer to Decks and Patios).
Safety fencing must comply with the Swimming Pools Act 1992 and Australian Standard AS 1926.2—1995, Swimming pool safety, Part 2: Location of fencing for private swimming pools.

Swimming pool/spa pump and associated equipment must be sound insulated or isolated (or both) so that the noise emitted does not exceed an LAeq of 5 dB(A) above background noise level in any octave band from 63.0 Hz centre frequencies inclusive at the property boundary, measured in accordance with Australian Standard AS 1055.1—1997, Acoustics—Description and measurement of environmental noise—General procedures.

headingfloat.b: Two storey single dwelling houses and two storey additions or alterations to single dwelling houses

block.txt: (excluding areas where the Australian Noise Exposure Forecast (ANEF) exceeds 20)
Maximum height of 6.5m from ground level to the ceiling and 8m to the highest point of the roof.
Must be located a minimum of 1.5m off side boundaries.
The two storey component of any proposed dwelling or addition must not extend beyond 50% of the depth of an allotment measured from the primary street frontage.
Must be located behind the building line of the property or no further forward than the alignment of any existing building on any adjoining property, whichever is the greater setback.

The maximum amount of cut or fill is restricted to 0.6m and the cut must not extend further than 0.9m beyond the perimeter of the building. All fill must be retained within the perimeter of the buildings.
For new dwelling houses two carparking spaces must be provided behind the building line.
Any car spaces and access provided must comply with the requirements of Australian Standard AS 2890.1—1993Parking facilities, Part 1: Off-street car parking.
Any driveways provided must be designed to align with footpath crossing levels issued by the Council.
New dwellings must be entitled to at least a 3.5 star rating under the House Energy Rating Scheme (NatHERS).

Additions and alterations to existing dwellings must comply with insulation (roof, wall and floor), hot water system, AAA rated fittings and clothes dryer requirements as per the existing development control plan requirements for single dwelling additions.
Works are not to include side or rear first floor balconies.
Works are not to include kitchen areas on the first floor.
Works are not to include installation of oil or solid fuel heating appliances.
Must comply with the Council’s construction standards for buildings located in bushfire prone areas or relevant Council building standards.

Work on that part of the residential premises used for the purpose of preparation or storage of food (or both) for sale to the public as part of a home activity use, must comply with the Food Regulation 2001, the Council’s Code for Food Premises and Code for Commercial Home Catering.
Work does not include any commercial mechanical exhaust ventilation system.
Maximum floorspace ratio is 0.4:1.
Minimum landscaped area is 50% of the site area.

heading.b: Complying development in the following zones—

block.txt: 3 (d) Neighbourhood Business
4 (a) General Industrial
4 (b) Light Industrial
4 (c1) Special Industrial (Oil Refining)
4 (c2) Special Industrial
5 (a) Special Uses “A”
6 (c) Private Recreation

entry.txt: Development consisting of the erection or carrying out of the following—

block.txt: Building must be an existing building authorised by a consent.

Only where there is an applicable development control plan or plan of management that specifies standards for the external treatment or appearance of the building and only where the development complies with the requirements of the applicable development control plan or plan of management.
Work must not reduce fire safety or accessibility to a fire exit.
Work must not contravene any conditions of any development consent applicable to the building or its use.
Building must be an existing building authorised by a consent.
Work must not reduce fire safety or accessibility to a fire exit.

Work must not increase the existing gross floor area of industrial premises except where it is an internal mezzanine floor, where that area may be increased by up to a maximum floor area of 50m2 but only for the purpose of storage or amenities.
Work must not increase existing gross floor area of business premises, including extensions within pedestrian arcades.

Work on that part of residential premises used for the purpose of preparation or storage (or both) of food for sale to the public as part of a home activity use, must comply with the Food Regulation 2001, the Council’s Code for Food Premises and Code for Commercial Home Catering.
Work does not include any commercial mechanical exhaust ventilation systems.

Work on food shops or restaurants must comply with the Food Regulation 2001, the Council’s Code for Food Premises, the Clean Air (Plant and Equipment) Regulation 1997, the Protection of the Environment Operations Act 1997, AS/NZS 1668.1:1998 and AS 1668.2—2002.
Alterations to an existing food shop or restaurant do not include the construction or installation of an externally mounted or located exhaust duct, fan or refrigeration unit.

Work on hairdressers, beauty salons or skin penetration premises must comply with the Public Health Act 1991 and Regulations under that Act, the NSW Health Department’s Skin Penetration Guidelines, published in July 1999 (if appropriate) and the Local Government (Orders) Regulation 1999.

Existing sound producing machinery or fittings associated with or forming part of the existing mechanical ventilation system or refrigeration system, must be sound insulated or isolated (or both) so that the noise emitted does not exceed an LAeq of 5 dB(A) above the background level in any octave band from 63.0 Hz centre frequencies inclusive at the boundary of the site (in accordance with any relevant Australian Standards). Any noise emitted must not include any tonal, impulsive or intermittent characteristics.
Demolition is only permitted of a building the erection of which is identified in this Schedule as complying development.
Not including decontamination, rehabilitation or remediation of a contaminated site.
Demolition must be carried out in accordance with any relevant Australian Standards.

headingfloat.b: Subdivision for one or more of the following purposes only:

block.txt: widening of a public road by a public authority,

adjusting a boundary between allotments, but only if the new lots comply with Chapter 5. The subdivision must not result in an increased number of lots, the re-orientation of the existing allotments or redefinition of the Mean High Water Mark,
correcting an encroachment on an allotment, but only if the new lots comply with Chapter 5,

strata subdivision of any building, except dual occupancy housing, approved and constructed after 1 July 1988 subject to the development conforming with all conditions of any applicable development consent,
consolidating allotments, if it is development,
the creation of an allotment for public reserve purposes but only where the residue lot or lots comply with the minimum size standards of Chapter 5.
